issue.title: (SDF Spec) clarify the semantic of having multiple links in a model.

content.raw:
The concept of a `model` is meta information placed on top of the underlying physics engines. The model needs a frame that will be updated by the physics engine. So, we have to tie the model to a link (which is actually represented in the physics engine).

We prefer to tie the model frame to a single link because:

1. It's possible to have a fixed frame of reference to multiple free links. Think of a rubble pit, where each piece of rubble is a free link. You will want to place, and move, this model reliably and repeatedly which will be difficult if the model's frame constantly changes as each piece of rubble moves.

2. It's difficult to know what "toplevel" links are. Should they be only links that are attached by a joint, but have no parent link? What if you have a model with a joint chain and also free links? I'm sure we could come up with a heuristic that defines "toplevel" links, but it would increase confusion.

3.  As you said, it's easier.

I'm leaning toward updating the documentation.
